member.name: T:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies how dates are formatted when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.IsoDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. "2012-03-21T05:40Z".

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.MicrosoftDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the Microsoft JSON format, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/".

member.name: T:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Noemax.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol

member.name: F:Noemax.Compression.FlushMode.NoFlush
member.summary: Do not explicitly flush the internal state of the encoder.

member.name: F:Noemax.Compression.FlushMode.FlushSync
member.summary: Flush the internal state of the encoder into the output buffer to ensure that all bytes compressed up to this point can be decompressed by decoding the output produced up to this point.

member.name: F:Noemax.Compression.FlushMode.Finish
member.summary: Flush the internal state of the encoder into the output buffer and write the final block to conclude the encoding.

member.name: T:Noemax.Compression.ICompressionEncoder
member.summary: Defines the interface of the compression algorithm encoder.
member.remarks: ICompressionEncoder is a low-level programming interface that provides direct control over the input and output buffers used by the compression method. Using this interface for in-memory compression avoids the extra overhead, in terms of both memory consumption and memory copy operations, that is being imposed by using compressed streams.

member.name: M:Noemax.Compression.ICompressionEncoder.Encode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Noemax.Compression.FlushMode,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads bytes from the specified input buffer and writes compressed bytes into the specified output buffer.
member.param: The input buffer from which to read the bytes to compress.
The offset in the input buffer at which to start reading the bytes to compress.
The number of bytes to read from the input buffer.
The output buffer into which to write the compressed bytes.
The offset in the output buffer at which to start writing the compressed bytes.
The maximum number of compressed bytes to write into the output buffer.
The flush mode that specifies whether and how to explicitly flush the internal state of the encoder into the output buffer.
Returns the number of bytes read from the input buffer.
member.returns: The number of the compressed bytes written into the output buffer.

remarks.para: When Encode is called, the encoder consumes bytes from the input buffer and returns the number of bytes consumed in the parameter and the number of compressed bytes produced in the return value.

The encoder can buffer both input and output in its internal buffer, so it might consume input without producing any output until it is ready to flush its internal state. To force the encoder to produce output, its internal state must be explicitly flushed.

Depending on the compression algorithm, a minimal amount of output buffer space might be required for compressed bytes to be produced. When the output buffer space is insufficient for the encoder to produce any amount of compressed bytes, it consumes input until its internal buffer is full but does not produce any output. Eventually both the returned and the return value of Encode become 0, despite the provided being greater than 0. This indicates that is too low for the encoder to operate and a larger output buffer space must be provided.

When the internal state of the encoder is explicitly flushed by setting flushMode to FlushMode.FlushSync or FlushMode.Finish, the encoder consumes input and produces output until all input is consumed and all its internal state is flushed to the output. Encode must be called repeatedly until the returned inputUsed is equal to the provided inputCount and the return value is 0. This indicates that all input has been consumed and all output produced has been flushed, provided that maxOutputCount is known to be sufficient for the encoder to operate.
If the internal state of the encoder needs to be flushed without providing any input, use Flush.

member.name: M:Noemax.Compression.ICompressionEncoder.Flush(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Noemax.Compression.FlushMode)
member.summary: Flushes the internal state of the encoder into the specified output buffer.
member.param: The output buffer into which to write the compressed bytes.
The offset in the output buffer at which to start writing the compressed bytes.
The maximum number of compressed bytes to write into the output buffer.
The flush mode that specifies whether and how to explicitly flush the internal state of the encoder into the output buffer.
member.returns: The number of the compressed bytes written into the output buffer.

member.name: M:Noemax.Compression.ICompressionEncoder.Reset
member.summary: Resets encoder state.

member.name: T:Noemax.Compression.ICompressionDecoder
member.summary: Defines the interface of the compression algorithm decoder.
member.remarks: ICompressionDecoder is a low-level programming interface that provides direct control over the input and output buffers used by the compression method. Using this interface for in-memory compression avoids the extra overhead, in terms of both memory consumption and memory copy operations, that is being imposed by using compressed streams.

member.name: M:Noemax.Compression.ICompressionDecoder.Decode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads compressed bytes from the specified input buffer and writes decompressed bytes into the specified output buffer.
member.param: The input buffer from which to read the bytes to decompress.
The offset in the input buffer at which to start reading the bytes to decompress.
The number of bytes to read from the input buffer.
The output buffer into which to write the decompressed bytes.
The offset in the output buffer at which to start writing the decompressed bytes.
The maximum number of decompressed bytes to write into the output buffer.
Returns the number of bytes read from the input buffer.
member.returns: The number of the decompressed bytes written into the output buffer.

remarks.para: When Decode is called, the decoder consumes bytes from the input buffer and returns the number of bytes consumed in the inputUsed parameter and the number of compressed bytes produced in the return value.

Depending on the compression algorithm, a minimal amount of output buffer space might be required for decompressed bytes to be produced. When the output buffer space is insufficient for the decoder to produce any amount of decompressed bytes, it consumes input until its internal buffer is full but does not produce any output. Eventually both the returned inputUsed and the return value of Decode become 0, despite the provided being greater than 0. This indicates that is too low for the decoder to operate and a larger output buffer space must be provided.

member.name: M:Noemax.Compression.ZlibCompression.CreateOutputStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an output stream that compresses the data and writes compressed bytes into the specified underlying stream.
member.param: The underlying stream to which to write the compressed bytes.

Specifies the compression level to be used when compressing. It may be set to an integer from 1 to 9. Generally, lower compression levels result in faster performance while higher compression levels result in better compression.
If True then the underlying stream is left open when this stream is closed, otherwise the underlying stream is closed when this stream is closed.
member.returns: The stream to write data to be compressed.

member.param: The underlying stream from which to read compressed bytes.

member.returns: The stream to read decompressed data.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.DeflateInputStream.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates asynchronous read operation which reads and decompresses data from the compressed stream and stores it into the specified buffer.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the decompressed bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.
member.returns: An object that represents the asynchronous read operation, which could still be pending.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.DeflateInputStream.EndRead(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous read to complete.
member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request to finish.
member.returns: The number of bytes decompressed.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.DeflateStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,Noemax.GZip.CompressionMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: By default, DeflateStream owns the underlying stream, so closing the stream also closes the underlying stream. Note that the state of the underlying stream can affect the usability of the stream. Also, no explicit checks are performed, so no additional exceptions are thrown when the new instance is created.

If an instance of the DeflateStream class is created with the mode parameter equal to Compress, header information is inserted immediately. If no further action occurs, the stream appears as a valid, empty, compressed file.

member.param: The stream to compress or decompress.
One of the CompressionMode values that indicates the action to take.
If True then the underlying stream is left open when this stream is closed, otherwise the underlying stream is closed when this stream is closed.

member.name: T:Noemax.GZip.ExtraFieldCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of GZip header fields.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.ExtraFieldCollection.Add(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds the header to the list of GZip headers.

remarks.para: Each GZip header extra-field is identified by two 8-bit values (ID1 and ID2), which can be represented as a single 16-bit unsigned integer where ID1 is the most significant 8 bits and ID2 is the less significant 8 bits of its binary representation.
Use this method if it's more comfortable to provide the ID as a single Int16 value. To provide the ID as two 8-bit fields use Add(Byte, Byte, Byte[]) overload.

member.param: The 16-bit unsigned integer identifier of the header field.
The array of bytes to be stored in header field.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.ExtraFieldCollection.Add(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds the header to the list of GZip headers.

remarks.para: Each GZip header extra-field is identified by two 8-bit values (ID1 and ID2).
Use this method if it's more comfortable to provide the ID as two 8-bit values. To provide the ID as a single 16-bit unsigned integer use Add(Int32, Byte[]) overload.

member.param: The 8-bit ID1 value.
The 8-bit ID2 value.
The array of bytes to be stored in the header field.
member.overloads: Adds the header to the list of GZip headers.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.ExtraFieldCollection.GetByID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the header associated with the ID represented as a 16-bit unsigned integer.
member.returns: The array of bytes stored in the header field.

remarks.para: Each GZip header extra-field is identified by two 8-bit values (ID1 and ID2), which can be represented as a single 16-bit unsigned integer where ID1 is the most significant 8 bits and ID2 is the less significant 8 bits of its binary representation.
Use this method if it's more comfortable to provide the ID as a single Int16 value. To provide the ID as two 8-bit fields use Get(Byte, Byte) overload.

member.param: The 16-bit unsigned integer identifier of the header field.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.ExtraFieldCollection.Get(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the GZip header associated with the ID represented as two ANSI character octet.
member.returns: The array of bytes stored in the header field.

remarks.para: Each GZip header extra-field is identified by two 8-bit values (ID1 and ID2).
Use this method if it's more comfortable to provide the ID as two 8-bit values. To provide the ID as a single 16-bit unsigned integer use Get(Int32) overload.

member.param: The 8-bit ID1 value.
The 8-bit ID2 value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Specifies the window size to be used when compressing (FOR DECOMPRESSION CHANGE TO: decompressing). It may be set to an integer from 8 to 15. Generally, lower values result in lower memory usage while higher values result in better compression. The windowBits used when decompressing must be the same as or higher than the windowBits used when compressing.

member.name: M:Noemax.GZip.GZipInputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The underlying stream from which to read compressed bytes.
If True then the underlying stream is left open when this stream is closed, otherwise the underlying stream is closed when this stream is closed.

Specifies the window size to be used when decompressing. It may be set to an integer from 8 to 15. Generally, lower values result in lower memory usage while higher values result in better compression. The windowBits used when decompressing must be the same as or higher than the windowBits used when compressing.

If set to True then the compression method implementation will not use any managed pointers. Otherwise implementation is selected automatically depending on whether current process allows managed pointers.

member.name: P:Noemax.GZip.GZipInputStream.CheckLength
member.summary: Gets and sets whether to check the length of uncompressed data.
member.remarks: The length check can fail on the files that are bigger than 4GB, since GZIP header does not support serializing bigger number. For this reason it's recommended to set this property to false in cases when original data might exceed the 4294967295 bytes.
member.value: true if the length of uncompressed data should be validated; otherwise false.

Specifies the compression level to be used when compressing. It may be set to an integer from 0 to 9. Generally, lower compression levels result in faster performance while higher compression levels result in better compression. Compression level 0 provides no compression at all.

Specifies the window size to be used when compressing. It may be set to an integer from 8 to 15. Generally, lower values result in lower memory usage while higher values result in better compression. member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.CompressionScheme
member.summary: Specifies the compression scheme to be used by WebSocket.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.CompressionScheme.None
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.CompressionScheme.Lzf4
member.summary: LZF4 compression method is applied only on the frame payload leaving frame headers uncompressed. This compression scheme is getting applied prior payload is masked and does not suffer from client to server payload masking, but benefit from the reusing compression state between frames.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.CompressionScheme.Deflate
member.summary: DEFLATE compression method is applied only on the frame payload leaving frame headers uncompressed. This compression scheme is getting applied prior payload is masked and does not suffer from client to server payload masking, but benefit from the reusing compression state between frames.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.CompressionScheme.Auto
member.summary: This compression scheme specifies that compression is to be negotiated with remote side automatically. Compression schemes that actually applied during communication will depend on local and remote side preferences. If remote side does not support any of available compression schemes, compression not will be used.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes
member.summary: Defines the constants to be used with for sending the WebSocket close frame status code that define the reason for closing the connection.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.Normal
member.summary: 1000 indicates a normal closure, meaning that the purpose for which the connection was established has been fulfilled.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.GoingAway
member.summary: 1001 indicates that an endpoint is "going away", such as a server going down or a browser having navigated away from a page.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.ProtocolError
member.summary: 1002 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.UnsupportedPayloadType
member.summary: 1003 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data it cannot accept (e.g., an endpoint that understands only text data MAY send this if it receives a binary message).

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.InconsistentData
member.summary: 1007 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message (e.g., non-UTF-8 [RFC3629] data within a text message).

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.MessageViolatesPolicy
member.summary: 1008 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy. This is a generic status code that can be returned when there is no other more suitable status code (e.g., 1003 or 1009) or if there is a need to hide specific details about the policy.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.MessageToBig
member.summary: 1009 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.ExtensionRequired
member.summary: 1010 indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake. The list of extensions that are needed SHOULD appear in the /reason/ part of the Close frame. Note that this status code is not used by the server, because it can fail the WebSocket handshake instead.

member.name: F:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketCloseCodes.UnexpectedFailure
member.summary: 1011 indicates that a endpoint is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from processing the message.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.Receive(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: /R eceives a message from the WebSocket connection.
member.param: The period of time during which operation must complete or timeout.
member.returns: The inbound message received.
member.remarks: After call to Receive is compelte the message is not necessary completelly received, only header of the first fragment is guaranteed to be received. Application can continue receiving message using methods provided by . When message is consumed application must call in other to release the message and allow subsequent message to be received.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.ReceiveMessage
member.summary: Receives the message from the WebSocket connection and returns that reads the message.
member.remarks: After call to Receive is complete the message is not necessary completelly received, only header of the first fragment is guaranteed to be received. Application can continue receiving the message using the returned by this method. When message is consumed application must close the input to allow subsequent messages to be received.

member.summary: Reads the message from the WebSocket connection and represents it as %System.IO.Stream%.

member.remarks: After call to Receive is complete the message is not necessary completelly received, only header of the first fragment is guaranteed to be received. Application can continue receiving the message using the returned by this method. When message is consumed application must close the input to allow subsequent messages to be received.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.PayloadMasking
member.summary: Get or sets whether payload of outbound messages is masked.

remarks.para: By default all messages from the client to the server are masked, while all messages from the server to the client are not masked, as required by the WebSocket protocol specification.
You can disable or enable masking by setting this property, but strict WebSocket implementations will drop the connection if masking requirements are not followed.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.Via
member.summary: Gets the _uri of remote endpoint.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.AuthenticationContext
member.summary: Gets the context object created during authentication of the WebSocket connection.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.OutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the current size of outbound message queue.
member.remarks: The size of outbound message queue reflects a amount of bytes pending to be sent asynchronously. It does not always reflect an amount of memory used by the outbound message queue per WebSocket connection.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.MaxOutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum size of outbound message queue.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.MaxOutboundFrameSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum size of outbound frame produced by the WebSocket.
member.value: The maximum size of outbound message frame in bytes.

remarks.para: The property controls the message fragmentation which is transparently performed by the WebSocket whenever necessary. If message is greater than the value specified by this property, it will be fragmented on frames that are smaller than specified value in bytes.
Note: When WebSocket framing extensions like compression are used by the channel, the final size of the frame may not necessary adhere to limit set by this property.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.Context

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocket.Extensions
member.summary: Gets a Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header string negotiated during the WebSocket handshake.
member.remarks: This string specifies the set of extensions that were agreed to be used during communication by both the server and the client side.

member.summary: Wait for ongoing operation to be complete during specified interval of time and closes the network connection.
member.param: The interval of time to wait for ongoing operations to be completed, prior closing the connection.
member.remarks: Prior connection is closed, WebSocketChannel waits for ongoing inbound and outbound transfers to be completed for specified period of time. Once timeout expire or all ongoing transfers are complete, connection is getting closed and all associated resources are released.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.SendBatchAsync(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketOutboundMessage[],System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sends the batch of the messages asynchronously.
member.param: The batch of messages to be sent.
The amount of time during which to wait for messages to be sent. TimeoutException will be thrown if messages is not completely sent within the specified period of the time.

remarks.para: When message is sent asynchronously it's first getting added into the outbound message queue. If another asynchronous send operation is currently in progress, then the messages in the outbound queue are sent once ongoing send operation is complete.
This method is thread-safe and can be called by multiple working threads concurrently.
You can control the size of the outbound message queue by using the and properties.

If outbound queue size exceed the limit specified by MaxOutboundQueueSize, is thrown. Messages bigger than the MaxOutboundQueueSize limit, cannot be sent asynchronously, unless MaxOutboundQueueSize value is increased to required size.
Warning: Application must not use synchronous and asynchronous send methods concurrently.

The period of time during which operation must be completed or timeout.
The AsyncCallback delegate that receives the notification of the completion of the asynchronous operation transmitting a request message.
The state associated to the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous request operation.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.SendMessage
member.summary: Streams the binary message to the remote side.
member.returns: The input to write the outbound message payload into.

remarks.para: This method is part of the streaming API, it allows to input messages of arbitrary size to remote side and avoid buffering entire message in the memory.
The input returned by this methods, writes the message payload directly into WebSocket connection.
Fragmentation and buffering are performed automatically. As soon as input buffer have to be flushed, buffered bytes are sent as a message fragment and become available on remote side.
If amount of bytes being written in single write operation is more than the size of input buffer, then these bytes are getting combined with bytes already buffered and sent as a single fragment.
You can force input to send buffered bytes by calling Flush() method.

You can input any amount of data as payload of the message until you decide to close it. Closing the input concludes the outbound message and final fragment frame is sent to remote side to indicate the end of the message.
The flow control is performed by TCP layer. The writing side is getting blocked if remote side input buffers are full. As faster remote side reads data, as faster the local side can continue sending.
remarks.b: Note: WebSocket connection cannot input more than one message concurrently.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.SendClose(System.Int16,System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sends the CLOSE control frame with specified statusCode and reason string.
member.param: The status code in range of 1000-4999 that specifies the reason why connection is being closed.
The string description of the status. Not required to be human readable but UTF-8 representation of the string should not exceed 125 bytes.
The amount of time to wait for CLOSE frame to be sent, prior TimeoutException is thrown.
member.remarks: When CLOSE frame is sent to remote side, no more messages or fragments can be sent though the connection. Local side can continue receiving pending messages until connection is closed by remote side. SendClose() does not close the connection, method need to be called to close connection and release all associated resources.

member.summary: Gets authentication context assigned to the channel when it was authenticated by the server endpoint.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.Connected
member.summary: Gets whether the channel connection is considered being alive.

remarks.para: This property reports the last operation state of the channel rather than performs the actual TCP connectivity checks.
When this property value is true, it indicates that channel is not being closed and last send/receive operations where completed successfully.

When this property value is false, it indicates that channel is either being closed or closed. This does not exclude the possibility that channel is in transition state and may still be able to send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.MaxOutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum number of bytes pending to be sent in outbound message queue.
member.remarks: When the number of bytes pending to be sent grows over the specified number, is thrown upon attempt to send more messages. WebSocket can continue sending messages once number goes below the specified number.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.OutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes pending to be sent in outbound message queue.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.Origin
member.summary: Gets origin string negotiated during the WebSocket handshake.
member.remarks: The Origin string may be required by WebSocket server to identify the script that runs on the client side when WebSocket is used by a browser client. This optional header is exchanged during the WebSocket handshake, both the server and the client may drop a connection if the value of the Origin string does not match their expectation.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.Protocol
member.summary: Gets and sets the list of Sub-Protocols used by the channel.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel.PayloadMasking
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the payload of outbound messages is masked.

remarks.para: By default all messages from the client to the server are masked, while all messages from the server to the client are not masked, as required by the WebSocket protocol specification.
You can disable or enable masking by setting this property, but strict WebSocket implementations will drop the connection if masking requirements are not followed.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketClient`1
member.summary: Provides the WebSocket protocol client connection.
member.typeparam: The IWebSockets implementation providing the application logic for handling connections and messages.

remarks.para: The instance of TService class must implement IWebSockets interface to handle messages received from the server side.

The TService instance will be created and initialized automatically unless already existing instance is provided to WebSocketClient constructor. When already existing instance is shared between multiple WebSocketClient objects, it can be used for broadcasting messages through multiple client connections.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel
member.summary: Provides methods and properties for exchanging messages over WebSocket connection.

remarks.para: WebSocketChannel provides methods and properties for sending messages through the WebSocket connection. The messages received through the channel are dispatched by the instance associated to the channel.
This class is used on both ends of WebSocket connection and provides truly duplex communication between client and server.

remarks.para: When message is sent asynchronously it is first getting added into the outbound message queue. If another asynchronous send operation is currently in progress, then the messages in the outbound queue are sent once ongoing send operation is complete.
This method is thread-safe and can be called by multiple working threads concurrently.
You can control the size of the outbound message queue by using the and properties.

If outbound queue size exceed the limit specified by MaxOutboundQueueSize, is thrown. Messages bigger than the MaxOutboundQueueSize limit, cannot be sent asynchronously, unless MaxOutboundQueueSize value is increased to required size.
Warning: Application must not use synchronous and asynchronous send methods concurrently.

member.summary: Sends the message asynchronously.
member.param: WebSocketOutboundMessage value containing the message.

Warning: Application must not use synchronous and asynchronous send methods concurrently.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.SendClose(System.Int16,System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sends the CLOSE control frame with specified statusCode and reason string.
member.param: The status code in range of 1000-4999 that specifies the reason why connection is being closed.
The string description of the status. Not required to be human readable but UTF-8 representation of the string should not exceed 125 bytes.
The amount of time to wait for CLOSE frame to be sent, prior TimeoutException is thrown.
member.remarks: When CLOSE frame is sent to remote side, no more messages or fragments can be sent though the connection. Local side can continue receiving pending messages until connection is closed by remote side. SendClose() does not close the connection, method need to be called to close connection and release all associated resources.

The amount of time to wait for queue to decrease below specified limit.
member.returns: true if the queue decreased below specified limit; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.Origin
member.summary: Gets origin string negotiated during the WebSocket handshake.
member.remarks: The Origin string may be required by WebSocket server to identify the script that runs on the client side when WebSocket is used by a browser client. This optional header is exchanged during the WebSocket handshake, both the server and the client may drop a connection if the value of the Origin string does not match their expectation.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.Protocol
member.summary: Gets the protocol negotiated during the WebSocket handshake.
member.remarks: Protocol string value is getting exchanged during the WebSocket handshake. Applications can use this value to negotiate the type of the protocol that is going to be used during communication e.g. 'chat', 'echo', 'atom' e.t.c.

members.member:
Gets and sets whether the payload of outbound messages is masked.
>
By default all messages from the client to the server are masked, while all messages from the server to the client are not masked, as required by the WebSocket protocol specification.
You can disable or enable masking my setting this property, but strict WebSocket implementations may drop the connection if masking requirements are not followed.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.ServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets and sets the instance of to perform dispatching of inbound messages.

remarks.para: Using this property a you can change the instance of IWebSockets that dispatches inbound message at any moment during communication.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.MaxOutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum size of the outbound message queue.

remarks.para: If asynchronous send operations would result in outbound queue size exceeding the specified limit, it fails with thrown.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.MaxOutboundFrameSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum size limit for outbound data frame.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.OutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets the current size of the outbound message queue in bytes.

remarks.para: The size of outbound queue does not indicate an amount of memory used by the queue, but it represents the number of bytes that is pending to be sent.
When message is added to the queue, it's payload is not getting copied, but referenced until the message is sent, so corresponding buffers should not be modified during asynchronous send operation.
Only messages that are being sent asynchronously getting stored in the outbound queue.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketConnectionChannel.Connected
member.summary: Gets whether the channel connection is considered being alive.

remarks.para: This property reports the last operation state of the channel rather than performs the actually TCP connectivity checks.
When this property value is true, it indicates that channel is not being closed and last send/receive operations where completed successfully.

When this property value is false, it indicates that channel is either being closed or closed. This does not exclude the possibility that channel is in transition state and may still be able to send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketClient.Extensions
member.summary: Gets and sets the list of extensions for be negotiated by WebSocket connection.

remarks.para: automatically negotiates supported extensions during the WebSocketHandshake, buy using this property you can override the extension configuration and extension parameters that would be used by the WebSocketClient. When this property is set, WebSocketClient will be using the value of this property rather than automatically generated Sec-WebSocket-Extension header.
You don't need to use this property unless you have to provide custom extension configuration.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity
member.summary: Provides properties that apply when SSL/TLS transport security is enabled.

remarks.para: If the URI of the target WebSocket server includes 'wss' or 'https' schema, SSL/TLS transport security is enabled automatically and server is expected to perform SSL/TLS handshake and provide server certificate. Communication would fail with AuthenticationException in cases when the target server does not support SSL/TLS transport security.
Note this class and all associated properties are not included into cryptography free versions of assemblies.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.SetClientCertificate(System.Byte[],System.Char[])
member.summary: Sets the certificate loaded from the specified PKCS12 storage to be used by the client for TLS authentication.
member.param: The array of bytes containing the PKCS#12 storage.
The password for PKCS#12 storage.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.SetClientCertificate(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Sets the certificate loaded from the specified PKCS12 storage to be used by the client for TLS authentication.
member.param: The array of bytes containing the PKCS#12 storage.
The password for PKCS#12 storage.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.UsernameForServer
member.summary: Gets and sets a credentials to be used to authenticate with WebSocket server if it requires HTTP authentication.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.UsernameForProxy
member.summary: Gets and sets a credentials to be used to authenticated with HTTP proxy.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.ServerCertificate
member.summary: Gets and sets the certificate that the target server is expected to provide during server authentication.

remarks.para: Default value is Null. If this property is not Null, the certificate specified by this property is getting compared to the server certificate provided by remote side during the SSL/TLS authentication. If they do not match each other, than server authentication fails and AuthenticationException is thrown.

If ServerCertificate does match the certificate provided by remote side, then the remote side certificate is accepted as valid. This type of authentication is useful when remote side is using self signed certificate and cannot be validated by certification authority.

member.name: E:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.OnValidateCertificate
member.summary: Event occurs during server certificate validation. Provide an event handler to perform an additional custom certificate validation.

remarks.para: The event handler is expected to throw an exception if a remote certificate is not valid; otherwise the it is considered being valid.
Note prior this event occurs, WebSocketClient performs internal certificate validation according to its security settings.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.TargetHost
member.summary: Gets and sets the string identifying the host the remote server certificate expected to specify in the the Subject field of certificate e.g. 'CN=www.myhost.com'.
member.remarks: Set this property to the common name of the X09Certificate used by the destination endpoint. If the common name of the certificate does not match neither the TargetHost property value nor the host specified in the URI of destination endpoint, the server certificate validation fails.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.CheckCertificateRevocation
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the client should check the server certificate chain for revocation.
member.remarks: Note: the self-signed certificates will fail the revocation check, so set this property to false. When using self-signed certificate.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketClientSecurity.ClientCertificate
member.summary: Gets and sets the client certificate to be used when client authentication is required by remote side.
member.remarks: Client certificate is used for client authentication and presented to the server side during SSL/TLS handshake. In order to use client certificate for client authentication, application should have an access the private key associated to the client certificate.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream
member.summary: Expose a WebSocket message as a input and provides methods and properties for streaming WebSocket messages.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream.ReadToFrameEnd
member.summary: Reads an entire frame or remaining bytes of the frame, depending on current input position.
member.returns: The bytes of the frame payload.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream.DrainWhenMessageClosed
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this stream should be drained when message is closed. Default value is True.
member.remarks: automatically reads the stream to the end when message is being closed after it was processed by application. This needed to insure message is completely read from network connection, so that next message can be received. Sometimes application needs defer processing of the stream later. In this case it can set the DrainWhenMessageClosed to False. However, no new messages will be received until the message stream is completely consumed.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream.IsFrameFinal
member.summary: Gets whether the current message frame is final.
member.remarks: When message is not fragmented its first and only frame is final.
member.value: Returns true if current frame is final; otherwise returns false.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream.FrameBytesRemaining
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes remaining to be read until the end of the current frame.
member.remark: When input is positioned on the start of the frame payload, this property returns the total number of bytes in the frame. As frame is being consumed this property returns the number of bytes remaining to be read until the end of the current frame.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Core.WebSocketMessageInputStream.BytesBuffered
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes buffered in the input buffer.
member.remarks: WebSocketMessageInputStream does not buffer entire frame, its internal buffer is fixed, so it may contain a part of the frame or multiple frames depending on the frame size.

remarks.para: By default all messages from the client to the server are masked, while all messages from the server to the client are not masked, as required by the WebSocket protocol specification.
You can disable or enable masking by setting this property, but strict WebSocket implementations will drop the connection if masking requirements are not followed.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketInboundMessage.ReadAsString(System.Int64)
member.summary: Buffers entire message in memory and decode it as UTF-8 encoded string.
member.param: The maximum number to buffer while receiving the message.
member.returns: The string decoded from the message content.
member.remarks: Since forward only streaming API is used to read the message, this method can be called only once. Subsequent calls to this method would result in InvalidOperationException thrown.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketInboundMessage.ReadAsString(System.Text.Encoding,System.Int64)
member.summary: Buffers entire message in memory and decode it as a string using specified encoding.
member.param: The maximum number to buffer while receiving the message.
The encoding to be used to decode the payload as a string.
member.returns: The string decoded from the message content.
member.remarks: Since forward only streaming API is used to read the message, this method can be called only once. Subsequent calls to this method would result in InvalidOperationException thrown.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketInboundMessage.ReadAsText
member.summary: Returns the text reader for reading message as text without ever buffering entire message in memory.
member.returns: Returns the TextReader for decoding the content of the message.

remarks.para: This method is part of the streaming API. Using the reader returned by this method you can consume large messages without ever loading entire message into memory. Only the part of the message is initially buffered.

As the application consumes data using the input the underlying channel will continue reading directly from TCP connection employing native flow control provided by TCP. This means that remote side blocks when local side input buffer is full and it resumes as soon as local side reads the data from the input buffers. As faster you read from the input as faster remote side will be able to send more data.

In case if message is fragmented, subsequent frames will be received and handled automatically as application reads from the input, until the final frame consumed. Once end of the message is reached the read operation will return 0 bytes.
Since forward only streaming API is used to read the message, this method can be called only once. Subsequent calls to this method would result in InvalidOperationException thrown.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketInboundMessage.ReadAsText(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Returns the text reader for reading message as text without ever buffering entire message in memory.
member.returns: Returns the TextReader for decoding the content of the message.

remarks.para: This method is part of the streaming API. Using the reader returned by this method you can consume large messages without ever loading entire message into memory. Only the part of the message is initially buffered.

As the application consumes data using the input the underlying channel will continue reading directly from TCP connection employing native flow control provided by TCP. This means that remote side blocks when local side input buffer is full and it resumes as soon as local side reads the data from the input buffers. As faster you read from the input as faster remote side will be able to send more data.

In case if message is fragmented, subsequent frames will be received and handled automatically as application reads from the input, until the final frame consumed. Once end of the message is reached the read operation will return 0 bytes.
Since forward only streaming API is used to read the message, this method can be called only once. Subsequent calls to this method would result in InvalidOperationException thrown.

member.param: The instance of Encoding to be used for converting the payload to the text.

member.summary: Returns the content of the message as input of bytes, which allows to read the message as it's getting received without buffering entire content in the memory.
member.returns: The input to read the message content.

remarks.para: This method is part of the streaming API. Using the input returned by this method you can consume large messages without ever loading entire message into memory. Only the part of the message is initially buffered.

As the application consumes data using the input the underlying channel will continue reading directly from TCP connection employing native flow control provided by TCP. This means that remote side blocks when local side input buffer is full and it resumes as soon as local side reads the data from the input buffers. As faster you read from the input as faster remote side is allowed to send data.

In case if message is fragmented, subsequent frames will be received and handled automatically as application reads from the input, until the final frame consumed. Once end of the message is reached the read operation will return 0 bytes.
Since forward only streaming API is used to read the message, this method can be called only once. Subsequent calls to this method would result in InvalidOperationException thrown.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServer`1
member.summary: Provides the WebSocket protocol server.
member.typeparam: The IWebSockets implementation providing the logic for handling connections and incoming messages.

remarks.para: The WebSocketServer class provides methods and properties for hosting on one or more WebSocket service endpoints. TService class must implement the interface to provide the application specific functionality.

AddEndpoint(_uri) method can be used to create the endpoint with a specified URI. If TService instance is not provided, it is created automatically once the first client connection is accepted. You can use AddEndpoint(_uri,TService) overload to create a endpoint for already created instance of TService.
starts listening on all endpoints.
closes all endpoints and release all associated resources.

closes all endpoints and release all associated resources.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity
member.summary: Provides the WebSocket server security settings that are applied when SSL/TLS transport security is enabled.
member.remarks: SSL/TLS security is enabled Required property is set to true or when the service endpoint URI includes 'wss' or 'https' schema. It's recommended to use Required property rather than relly on the URI, to make sure that security is forced on all endpoints. If SSL/TLS security is enabled the ServerCertificate must be set to the valid X509 certificate, otherwise server with fail to start and will be thrown.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The object owning the security settings.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication scheme to be used by the server endpoints.

member.name: E:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.UsernamePasswordAuthenticate
member.summary: Event trigger when basic HTTP authentication is performed.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.Required
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the SSL/TLS security is enabled for all endpoints.
member.remarks:
Setting this property to true ensures that security is getting enabled for all endpoints defined for the server.
If this property is set to false then only endpoints that have "wss" schema e.g. 'wss://www.myserver.com' will have transport security enabled.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.RequireClientCertificate
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the server should require clients to provide the their certificate for authentication.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.CheckCertificateRevocation
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the server should check the client certificate chain for revocation.
member.remarks: Note: the self-signed certificates will fail the revocation check. When using self-signed certificates, set this property to false,

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.ServerCertificate
member.summary: Gets and sets the certificate to be used by the server.
member.remarks: This property MUST be set to the valid X509Certificate when SSL/TLS security is enabled, otherwise InvalidOperationException exception will be thrown.

member.name: E:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketServerSecurity.ValidateCertificate
member.summary: Occurs when a client certificate validation is being validated by the server. Provide an the event handler to perform an additional custom certificate validation.

remarks.para: The event handler is expected to throw an exception if client certificate is not valid; otherwise the it is considered being valid.
Note prior this event occurs, WebSocketServer validates certificate according to its security settings. Please check the CheckCertificateRevocation properties for more details.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets
member.summary: Defines the contract that a service must implement in order to receive message and manage connections.

remarks.para: It preferable to use as the base class for service implementation, rather than implementing the IWebSockets interface, WebSocketService implements most of the methods defined by IWebSockets and provides most of required functionality. You need to implemented IWebSockets interface only if have to provide completely custom message processing, dispatching and connection management.

Methods of IWebSocket are being called by working threads that handle inbound messages and connections. It should be expected that multiple threads can call a same instance of IWebSockets concurrently.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnHandshake(System.Object,Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketHandshake)
member.summary: The method is called during the WebSocket handshake.
member.param: The initiator of event that performs WebSocket handshake on local endpoint.
The WebSocketHandshake instance.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnMessage(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketInboundMessage)
member.summary: This method is called when an inbound message is being received.
member.param: The channel through which the inbound message is being received.
The inbound message being received.
member.remarks: WebSocket working thread does not buffer entire message prior calling this method, provides the methods to either buffer the message prior consuming it or to consume it as a input.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnPing(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: This method is called when an inbound PING frame is received.
member.param: The channel through which the inbound PING frame was received.
The payload of the PING frame.
member.remarks: PONG reply is sent automatically unless connection is closed during the call to the OnPing method.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnPong(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: This method is called when an inbound PONG frame is received.
member.param: The channel through which the inbound PONG frame was received.
The payload of the PONG frame.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnOpen(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel)
member.summary: This method is called when a new channel being open.
member.param: The channel being open.
member.remarks: Both on the server and on the client side this method is called when connection from the client to the server is established and WebSocket handshake is complete.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnError(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.Exception)
member.summary: This method is called when a channel encounters an error.
member.param: The channel that encounters the error.
The exception related to the error.
member.remarks: All errors encountered by the channel during sending/receiving/dispatching messages are reported through this method. The channel that encountered the error is not necessary disconnected or closed, use the property to determine the status of the channel.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.IWebSockets.OnClose(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.Int16,System.String)
member.summary: This method is called when a channel is being closed.
member.param: The channel being closed.
The status code provided by the remote side to identify the reason for closing the connection.
The text description of the status code.

remarks.para: If the connection is being closed due to receiving a CLOSE control frame from the remote side, the statusCode and reason parameters may contain information provided by the remote side to identify the reason for closing the connection.
When this method is called, messages might still be sent successfully to the remote side for a short period of time. However, no more messages are expected to be received from the remote side.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService
member.summary: Provides the base class implementation for interface.

remarks.para: WebSocketService is recommended to use as the base class for the service implementations. It provides methods and properties for managing the list of associated , sending and receiving messages through all connected channels and message broadcasting.
This class should be extended to provide application specific logic.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnHandshake(System.Object,Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketHandshake)
member.summary: The method is called during the WebSocket handshake, override this method to accept or to decline it.
member.param: The initiator of event that performs WebSocket handshake on local endpoint.
The WebSocketHandshake instance.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnOpen(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel)
member.summary: Handles the event triggered when a new channel is being open and associated to the service instance.
member.param: The channel being open and associated to the service instance.

remarks.para: The base implementation adds the channel to the list of associated channels and sets to a random literal GUID string.

When overriding this method you can provide additional application specific logic. For example, you can instantiate a new instance of the service and pass the channel to this instance by calling its OnOpen method, instead of OnOpen of the base class. This way you can control the number of channels handled by each instance of the service or group channels and service instances by any other criteria.

Adding the channel to more than one service instances is also possible, if channel is associated to more than one instance of WebSocketService, all service instances will be broadcasting messages to the channel. But only one instance specified by will be handling inbound messages.
Channel can be removed from the list of associated channels using the method.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnMessage(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketInboundMessage)
member.summary: Handles the inbound message based on the payload type. Override this method if you need to provide alternative functionality or use the streaming API.
member.param: The channel through which the message is being received.
The message being received.

remarks.para: The base implementation of this method evaluates the type of the data being received in the message payload by reading the opcode in the first frame. If message is fragmented it's getting buffered and interpreted as text or the binary byte array depending on whether this message is text or binary. Then the message is dispatched to or depending on the type of the message.
Overriding this method allows the use of alternative message processing using the streaming API exposed by the class.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnMessage(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.String)
member.summary: Handles a text message received from a specified channel.
member.param: The channel through which the message was received.
The text payload of the message.
member.remarks: This method does nothing and should to be override to provide application specific functionality.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnMessage(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: Handles a binary message received from a specified channel.
member.param: The channel through which the message was received.
The binary payload of the message.
member.remarks: This method does nothing and should to be override to provide application specific functionality.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnPing(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: This method is called when a PING frame received from a specified channel.
member.param: The channel through which the PING frame was received.
The payload of the PING frame.

remarks.para: The PONG response to the PING message is sent automatically, unless the channel is closed within OnPing method implementation.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnPong(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.ArraySegment{System.Byte})
member.summary: This method is called when a PONG frame received from a specified channel.
member.param: The channel through which PONG frame was received.
The payload of the PONG frame.
member.remarks: This method can be overrides if alternative functionality is needed.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnError(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.Exception)
member.summary: Handles a error occurred in a specified channel.
member.param: The channel that encounters the error..
The exception related to the error.

remarks.para: All errors encountered by the channel during sending/receiving/dispatching messages are reported through this method. The channel that encountered the error is not necessary disconnected or closed, use the property to determine the status of the channel.
The base implementation calls which drops the channel connection and then removes the channel from the list of associated channels using .

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.OnClose(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel,System.Int16,System.String)
member.summary: This method is called when a channel is being closed.
member.param: The channel being closed.
The status code provided by the remote side to identify the reason for closing the connection.
The text description of the status code.

remarks.para: If the connection is being closed due to receiving a CLOSE control frame from the remote side, the statusCode and reason parameters may contain information provided by the remote side to identify the reason for closing the connection.
When this method is called, messages might still be sent successfully to the remote side for a short period of time. However, no more messages are expected to be received from the remote side.
When this method is called the base implementation is removes the channel from the list of associated channels.
You can override this method to provide alternative functionallity.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.GetChannels
member.summary: Returns the list of the channels associated to the service instance.
member.returns: An array of WebSocketChannel objects.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.SendPing
member.summary: Sends the PING message to all channels associated to the service instance.

remarks.para: Once PING messages are sent, OnPong method will be called for each PONG reply received.
This method does not block while PING frame is sent, all PING frames are sent asynchronously.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.SendPing(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel})
member.summary: Sends the PING message to the specified list of channels.

remarks.para: Once PING messages are sent, OnPong method will be called for each PONG reply received.
This method does not block while PING frame is sent, all PING frames are sent asynchronously.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.SendToAll(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the text message to all channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The text message to send.

remarks.para: The message is sent synchronously by iterating the list of associated channels sequentially.
This method is not effective for broadcasting messages to large number of channels, where slow channels will delay the broadcasting.
Use this method in order to send message synchronously in cases when service instance handles a single channel or very few channels.

member.summary: Sends the binary message to all channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The segment of array of bytes referencing the bytes to be sent.

member.summary: Sends the binary message to all channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The array containing message to be sent.
The offset in the array where the binary message starts.
The number of bytes in the binary message.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.SendTo(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel},Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketOutboundMessage)
member.summary: Sends the message to the list of specified channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The list of channels to send message too.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.SendBatchAsync(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel[],Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketOutboundMessage[])
member.summary: Sends the batch of messages to the list of channels asynchronously.
member.param: The list of channels to send messages too.
The batch of messages to be send.

remarks.para: The batch of messages is getting enqueued into each channel outbound message queue and does not block the calling thread until the batch is sent. Once channel is ready to send next batch of messages entire outbound queue is treated as single batch and sent asynchronously.

Application can control the size of outbound queues by reading the WebSocketChannel.OutboundQueueSize property or setting the WebSocketChannel.MaxOutboundQueueSize property. This method is thread safe and can be called by multiple threads concurrently.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.SendBatchAsync(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketOutboundMessage[])
member.summary: Sends the batch of messages to all associated channels asynchronously.
member.param: The batch of messages to be send.
member.remarks:
The batch of messages is getting enqueued into each channel outbound message queue and does not block the calling thread until the batch is sent. Once channel is ready to send next batch of messages entire outbound queue is treated as single batch and sent asynchronously.
Application can control the size of outbound queues by reading the WebSocketChannel.OutboundQueueSize property or setting the WebSocketChannel.MaxOutboundQueueSize property.
This method is thread safe and can be called by multiple threads concurrently.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.Broadcast(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketOutboundMessage)
member.summary: Broadcasts the message to all channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The message to broadcast.
member.remarks:
Broadcast() performs message broadcasting to all connected channels in most efficient manner.
Instead of sending message into each channel sequentially as SendMessage(), Broadcast() broadcasts messages asynchronously to all channels and also preforms grouping of messages into batches whenever possible.
This method is thread safe and can be called by multiple working threads concurrently. Calling this method from multiple threads concurrently does not block those threads until current batch is sent, but helps to group messages into batches and improves the throughput.
No artificial delay is used to group messages into batches, in high throughput environment they are formed while previous batch is being broadcasted without delaying transfer.
Read SendBatchAsync for more details.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.Broadcast(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketOutboundMessage,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel})

member.param: The message to broadcast.

member.remarks:
Broadcast() performs message broadcasting to all connected channels in most efficient manner.
Instead of sending message into each channel sequentially as SendMessage(), Broadcast() broadcasts messages asynchronously to all channels and also preforms grouping of messages into batches whenever possible.
This method is thread safe and can be called by multiple working threads concurrently. Calling this method from multiple threads concurrently does not block those threads until current batch is sent, but helps to group messages into batches and improves the throughput.
No artificial delay is used to group messages into batches, in high throughput environment they are formed while previous batch is being broadcasted without delaying transfer.
Read SendBatchAsync for more details.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.AddChannel(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel)
member.summary: Adds the channel to the list of channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The channel to associate with the service instance.

remarks.para: All channels accepted by the service instance through are transparently added to the list of associated channels .

AddChannel can be used to associated the channel to a different service instances. For example chat client channel can be moved from one chat root into another. In order to implement this you can call RemoveChannel on the instance representing the current chat room and call AddChannel of another instance.
The same applies to the client side, you can add multiple client channels to the already exiting service instance and use it for broadcasting messages to multiple servers.

Note if channel is added to more than one instance of WebSocketService, all instances will be broadcasting messages to the channel. But only the instance specified by will be handling inbound messages. Channel can be removed from the list by using .

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.RemoveChannel(Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketChannel)
member.summary: Removes the channel from the list of channels associated to the service instance.
member.param: The channel to associate with the service instance.

remarks.para: All channels accepted by the service instance through the call to OnOpen method are getting added to the list of associated channels automatically.
RemoveChannel can be used to transfer accepted channels between different service instances.
For example:

Chat client channel can be moved from one chat root into another. In order to implement this you can call RemoveChannel on the instance representing one chat room and call AddChannel of the instance representing another chat room.
The same applies to the client side, you can add established client channels to the already exiting service instance, in order to use it for broadcasting messages to multiple servers.

member.summary: Closes all channels associated to the service instance within specification interval of time.
member.param: The maximum amount of time to wait for graceful disconnection.
member.remarks: If service fails to disconnect all channels gracefully in specified interval of time, it will close remaining channels without performing final close handshake, or waiting for ongoing operations to complete.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.WebSocketService.CalcTotalOutboundQueueSize
member.summary: Gets the total sizes of all outbound message queues associated to the service instance.

remarks.para: Calling this method calculate the sum of all outbound queue sizes, this involves thread synchronization and can be processing intensive.
The size of outbound message queue does not indicate the size of memory being used by message in the queue, but amount of data to be sent.
The outbound queue size equal 0, doesn't indicate all messages have been delivered to remote side, last asynchronous send operation can still be in progress and last batch of messages being sent.
This method is intended to be used for reporting the status of the service instance rather than flow control.

member.summary: The factory creating instances.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.Messaging.InvokerFactory
member.summary: The factory producing instances.

remarks.para: The factory is used in combination with MessageDispatcher to create runtime model for dispatching inbound messages to the methods exposed by the service.
determines if the methods have compatible signatures and can be called by invoker produced by the factory.

The Invoker instances produced by the factory can be either predefine generic classes that take suitable number of parameters similar to Action[T,T1,...] delegate or dynamically generated during runtime. Invoker produced by the factory is responsible to perform a call to the target method using the data deserialized from inbound message. It can perform any parameter transformation required and also process result produced by the method.

member.remarks: Once handler is published in will start providing the JavaScript file with name specified by the property on the associated service endpoints. This file can be reference from the HTTP page e.g. <script src="http://hostname:9998/echo/PowerWSM.js">.

member.name: M:Noemax.WebSockets.Messaging.JsonClientProxyProvider.Unpublish
member.summary: Unpublished the Non-WebSocket HTTP handler.
member.remark: This methods reverts the effect of method and removes the JavaScript client proxy request handler from the service endpoints.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Messaging.JsonClientProxyProvider.ClientProxyFileName
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the client proxy file to be generated by the .
member.remarks: Browser clients can request the JavaScript proxy file that simplify access to the messaging service by referencing the file from the HTML page e.g. <script src="http://hostname:9998/echo/PowerWSM.js">.

member.name: P:Noemax.WebSockets.Messaging.JsonClientProxyProvider.JavaScript
member.summary: Gets and sets JavaScript generated by the .
member.remarks:
You can provide your own JavaScript client proxy code by assigned this property. If this property is not assigned then proxy is generated automatically when
is called.

member.summary: Gets and sets the action string for matching a message.

member.name: T:Noemax.WebSockets.Messaging.WebSocketMessagingService
member.summary: The base class for the service that performs dispatching of the inbound messages based of the type of the object deserialized from the the message content and the action string provided by inbound message.
member.remarks: The content of an inbound message is deserialized using the DefaultSerializer, then the deserialized object is dispatched to the method based on its Type and/or Action. The method that receives the object must be marked with and must be exposed by either the class inherited from the MessagingService or the instance of the class provided as parameter to the MessageService constructor. The last parameters of the method indicates the type of objects it receives, while first optional parameters can be type. If method takes WebSocketChannel as a first parameter then it will be assigned to the channel that received the message.
